info.title: OneDrive
info.description: Connect to OneDrive to manage your files. You can perform various actions such as upload, update, get, and delete on files in OneDrive.

get.description: This operation gets the metadata for a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

get.description: This operation gets the metadata of a file using the path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The unique path of the file.

post.description: This operation creates a share link for a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of link

get.description: This operation gets the content of a file using the path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The unique path of the file.

parameters.name: inferContentType
parameters.description: A boolean value (true, false) to infer content-type based on extension.

get.description: This operation gets the content of a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: inferContentType
parameters.description: A boolean value (true, false) to infer content-type based on extension.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: The unique path of the folder.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file. Certain characters are disallowed by OneDrive and will be replaced by underscores.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the file.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: The unique path of the folder.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the file. Certain characters are disallowed by OneDrive and will be replaced by underscores.

parameters.description: The search query to use

patch.description: This operation appends to a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the file.

post.description: This operation uploads a file from a URL to OneDrive.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The url to the source file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination file path, including target filename.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'.

post.description: This operation copies a file within OneDrive.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination file path, including target filename.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'.

post.description: This operation copies a file within OneDrive by path.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The unique path of the file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination file path, including target filename.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'.

post.description: This operation moves or renames a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination file path, including target filename.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'.

post.summary: Move or rename a file using path
post.description: This operation moves or renames a file using the path.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The unique path of the file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination file path, including target filename.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'.

get.description: This operation converts a file to another format. The list of supported conversions can be found at https://aka.ms/onedriveconversions

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The target file type

x-ms-file-name.description: The name of the file or folder.

get.description: This operation converts a file to another format using the path. The list of supported conversions can be found at https://aka.ms/onedriveconversions

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The unique path of the file.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The target file type

x-ms-file-name.description: The name of the file or folder.

get.description: This operation gets the tags of a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

post.description: This operation adds a tag to a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

delete.description: This operation removes a tag from a file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

get.description: This operation gets the thumbnail of a file. The thumbnail will only be valid for 6 hours.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the thumbnail to retrieve.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the file.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the file.

get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a new file is created in a folder. Files larger than 50 MB will be skipped and not returned by this trigger. Files moved within OneDrive are not considered new files.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder.

parameters.name: inferContentType
parameters.description: A boolean value (true, false) to infer content-type based on extension.

parameters.name: x-ms-operation-context
parameters.description: Special header to enable operation simulation

x-ms-file-id.description: The unique identifier of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-name.description: The name of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-path.description: The path of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-name-encoded.description: The name of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-path-encoded.description: The path of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-etag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

Content-Type.description: The content type of the file or folder.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a file to the OneDrive folder you selected.

get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a new file is created in a folder. Files larger than 50 MB will be skipped and not returned by this trigger. Files moved within OneDrive are not considered new files.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder.

parameters.name: includeSubfolders
parameters.description: Include items in subfolders

parameters.name: inferContentType
parameters.description: A boolean value (true, false) to infer content-type based on extension.

parameters.name: simulate
parameters.description: Simulate this call.

parameters.name: x-ms-operation-context
parameters.description: Special header to enable operation simulation

x-ms-file-id.description: The unique identifier of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-name.description: The name of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-path.description: The path of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-path-encoded.description: The path of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-etag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

Content-Type.description: The content type of the file or folder.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a file to the OneDrive folder you selected.

get.summary: When a file is created (properties only)
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a new file is created in a folder. Files moved within OneDrive are not considered new files.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return by single trigger run (1-100). Note that 'Split On' setting can force trigger to process each item individually.

parameters.name: x-ms-operation-context
parameters.description: Special header to enable operation simulation

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a file to the OneDrive folder you selected.

x-ms-file-name.description: The name of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-path.description: The path of the file or folder.

x-ms-file-etag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

get.description: This operation gets the list of files and subfolders in a folder.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder.

parameters.name: includeSubfolders
parameters.description: Include items in subfolders

get.description: This operation gets the list of files and subfolders in a folder.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of results to return.

get.description: This operation gets the list of files and subfolders in the root folder.
This operation gets the list of root folders.

post.description: This operation extracts an archive file into a folder (example: .zip). Maximum archive size is 50 MB and 100 files inside.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The path to the archive file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The path to extract the archive contents.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination files if set to 'true'.

get.description: This operation finds files within a folder using search or name pattern match.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query to use

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder.

parameters.name: findMode
parameters.description: The search method to use. "Search" mode searches your OneDrive using the search query (similar a normal search engine). When "Regular Expression Pattern Match" mode is selected, the search query will be treated as a regex pattern, and it will return files with names that match the query

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return (1-100)

get.summary: Find files in folder by path
get.description: This operation finds files within a folder by path using search or name pattern match.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query to use

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The unique path of the folder.

parameters.name: findMode
parameters.description: The search method to use. "Search" mode searches your OneDrive using the search query (similar a normal search engine). When "Regular Expression Pattern Match" mode is selected, the search query will be treated as a regex pattern, and it will return files with names that match the query

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return (1-100)

Id.description: The unique identifier of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

NameNoExt.description: The name of the file or folder, without the file extension.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The file or folder size in bytes.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The file locator of the file or folder.

LastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the file or folder.

WebUrl.description: A URL that points to the file or folder.

Url.description: A URL that points to the thumbnail.

BlobMetadataPage.description: Represents a page of blob metadata.

nextLink.description: A URL which can be used to retrieve the next page.
